The Schinderhübel locality is situated near the peak of the left hill

The locality is to the left of the peak here

Brashed-in digging in a classical occurrence

Later research work near a classical occurrence
Photo by P. Rozsíval

There is a pegmatite vein visible in the front part of the digging

Green-blue crystal of beryl 3 cm, tiny tables of chrysoberyl growing over the beryl
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Red crystal of spessartine (3 mm) with muscovite (big greyish table) and white needlelike sillimanite

Needlelike aggregate of sillimanite, sample 7 x 5 cm
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Green-yellow six compound crystals of chrysoberyl 12 x 7 mm in sillimanite
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Two compound crystals of chrysoberyl 14 mm in pegmatite
Photo by J. Král

Spessartine (red) with gahnite (dark green) in pegmatite 5 x 4 cm
Photo by P. Novotný

White needlelike aggregate of bavenite 11 x 5 mm
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Bavenite, the mineral is magnified approximately 20x
